description.narrative: Forest and Farm Facility (FFF) is a partnership launched in 2012 between FAO IIED and IUCN to promote sustainable forest and farm management by enhancing the organization and capacity of local people and by supporting local national regional and internatio nal organizations and platforms. The key goal of the FFF is to strengthen smallholder women community and Indigenous Peoples? groups for improved livelihoods and policy engagement for managing forests and farms in an integrated and sustainable way. The Fac ility also aims to enhance multi-sectoral stakeholder policy platforms with governments at local and national levels forest and farm producer organizations and stakeholders as well as the private sector and promote investments in sustainable forest and far m management. In addition the FFF enhances linkages between the local and global agendas and initiatives. The FFF is currently active in 10 countries: Bolivia Guatemala Nicaragua Gambia Liberia Kenya and Zambia Myanmar Nepal and Vietnam. Synergies are soug ht in countries where Finland has bilateral development cooperation. The FFF activities have contributed to strengthened cooperation between forest and farm producer organizations stakeholders and decision-makers including forest sector programmes. The Fac ility has also supported national policy processes in a number of countries and provided training at both national and regional levels. The FFF's overall progress and outputs are assessed by the Facility's monitoring and learning system. In 2015 Finland's support is 14 million euros.
